intro: Triplaris euryphylla, commonly known as the broadleaf triplaris, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. It is often found in moist, lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
